sen.j: 如意自在（にょいじざい）は、鳥山石燕による妖怪画集『百器徒然袋』にある日本の妖怪で、付喪神（器物が変化した妖怪）の一種。
sen.e: Nyoijizai is a Japanese specter included in a specter art collection book entitled "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" by Sekien TORIYAMA and is a kind of the Tsukumo-gami (a specter changed from a utensil).

sen.j: 「如意仏具」とは僧侶の持つ孫の手のような仏具のことで、その如意が変化して生まれたのがこの妖怪とされる。
sen.e: Nyoi-butsugu' is a Buddhist altar article which looks like a magonote (backscratcher) and Nyoijizai specter was created by changing the Nyoi.

sen.j: 頭部に如意を頂き、体形は人間に近く、指には鋭い爪を備えている。
sen.e: Nyoijizai has a Nyoi on its head, the shape of its body is close to that of the human, and its fingers are equiped with sharp nails.

sen.j: 孫の手同様に長い腕と指で痒いところを掻く妖怪とされるが、油断すると爪で手痛い傷を負わされるともいう。
sen.e: It is said to be a specter which scratches with a long arm and fingers the itchy spots just like the backscratcher does, but it also is said that, if one is not careful, one may be painfully hurt.
